glsa.title: CrackLib: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in CrackLib could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: CrackLib is a library used to enforce strong passwords by comparing user selected passwords to words in chosen word lists.

description.p: A stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the FascistGecosUser function of lib/fascist.c.

impact.p: A local attacker could set a specially crafted GECOS field value in “/etc/passwd”; possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, a Denial of Service condition, or the escalation of privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
